meanings.definition: Not free; lacking freedom or liberty.
meanings.sent1: The bird was unfree in its small cage.
meanings.sent2: The prisoner felt unfree behind bars.
meanings.sent3: The unfree fish wished to explore the vast ocean.
meanings.sent4: Her unfree mind was trapped in a cycle of fear.
meanings.sent5: The unfree butterfly longed to soar through the open sky.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something not free; to restrict or limit freedom.
meanings.sent1: The king unfreed the prisoners after the war.
meanings.sent2: The new law unfrees citizens from certain rights.
meanings.sent3: The magician unfreed the rabbit from the hat with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: The lock unfreed its hold on the treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: The spell unfreed the princess from the evil enchantment.
